sentences.english: Rough- hewn , angular notes, like stones in the wall of a churchyard.
sentences.chinese: 粗獷，生硬的音符，像墓地圍牆上的石頭般。

sentences.english: Steelmaking has been a high consumption rough-oriented industry.
sentences.chinese: 一直以來，鍊鋼都是一種高消耗的粗獷型工業。

sentences.english: Traceable among the rough marks of hatchet and chisel were delicate lines zigzagging .
sentences.chinese: 近看，耐人尋味，在粗獷的斧鑿中行走着蜿蜒的線。

sentences.english: A real man somtimes will demonstrates his manly disposition.
sentences.chinese: 真正的男子漢總要展現粗獷的一面。

sentences.english: He had a bluff, rough-and-ready face.
Bright colours and bold strokes characterize his early paintings.
sentences.chinese: 他早期繪畫的特點是色彩鮮明，筆法粗獷。

sentences.english: He was a bear of a man, but kind and gentle.
sentences.chinese: 他是個長得粗獷的男人，但舉止溫文爾雅。

sentences.english: New and classic camo prints look rugged on urban streets.
sentences.chinese: 新款和經典的迷彩印花在都市街道上顯得粗獷硬朗。

sentences.english: Update a tie-dye dress with hardware jewelry and rugged boots.
sentences.chinese: 一條蠟染的長裙與重金屬首飾和粗獷皮靴的搭配。

sentences.english: Childishness of embroidery cloth embroidered affixed ruggedness generous, commonly used in the larger pattern designs.
sentences.chinese: 貼布繡繡品粗獷大方，常用於面積較大的花紋圖案。

sentences.english: Ma coarse fiber Hardware, fabric density generally smaller, more feeling of rough air.
sentences.chinese: 麻纖維較粗硬，織物密度一般較小，更感覺粗獷透氣。
在這雄偉粗獷的太行山中。

definition: simple and unadorned (of art, architecture etc)
simple and honest/unsophisticated/(music etc) deep and resounding
mellow and full/suave/smooth and round/rich (in voice)
implicit charm in rhyme or sound/hinted appeal/interest
line (in drawing, calligraphy etc)/the lines or contours of a three-dimensional object (hairstyle, clothing, car etc)
brush stroke in Chinese painting and calligraphy/brushwork/style of drawing or writing
